intro: Koanophyllon puberulum, commonly known as the woolly blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and small blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into hard, capsule-like fruits. Koanophyllon puberulum is often found in open habitats such as plains, foothills, and disturbed areas.
